Total | <1 year | Both | 2009: Healthy life expectancy at birth varies widely across U.S. counties, with mountain regions in Colorado standing out for notably longer, healthier lives. In contrast, some rural and Native American areas, such as parts of South Dakota, experience much shorter healthy lifespans. These patterns highlight persistent geographic health disparities, where people in certain communities—often more remote or underserved—face greater barriers to long-term well-being compared to those in more affluent or resource-rich regions.
